\Aura\View

\Aura\ViewTwoStep

Provides a TwoStepView pattern implementation; this allows for an inner ("core") view and and outer ("layout") view as commonly used by web apps.

$inner_paths

$inner_paths : array

The paths to search when finding an inner view template.

Type

array

Tags

None found

$inner_view

$inner_view : mixed

The inner view to use. This may be one of three types:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A callable to execute. It should take no parameters.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

Type

mixed

Tags

None found

$inner_view_var

$inner_view_var : string

The name of the variable in the outer view template that should be replaced with the output of the inner view template.

Type

string

Tags

None found

$template

$template : \Aura\View\Template

The Template object to be used when rendering the inner view and outer view.

Type

\Aura\View\Template

Tags

None found

$outer_paths

$outer_paths : array

The paths to search when finding the outer view template.

Type

array

Tags

None found

$outer_view

$outer_view : mixed

The inner view to use. This may be one of three types:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A callable to execute; it should be a single parameter, $inner, which is the content of the inner view.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

Type

mixed

Tags

None found

setInnerView()

setInnerView(mixed $inner_view) : void

Sets inner view specification. The specification may be:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A closure to execute; it should take no parameters.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

Parameters

mixed $inner_view

The inner view specification.

Tags

None found

getInnerView()

getInnerView(string $format) : mixed

Returns the inner view specification.

Parameters

string $format

Only return the specification for this .format; if null, return all formats.

Returns

mixed

Tags

None found

setOuterView()

setOuterView(mixed $outer_view) : void

Sets the outer view specification. The specification may be:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A callable to execute; it should take one parameter, $inner, which is the content of the inner view.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

Parameters

mixed $outer_view

The outer view specification.

Tags

None found

getOuterView(string $format) : mixed

Returns the outer view specification.

Parameters

mixed

render()

render() : string

Renders the inner view and outer view and returns the resulting output, negotiating a format from the accept header values.

Returns

string —

The rendered two-step view results.

None found

renderView()

renderView(mixed $view, array $paths, string $default) : string

Renders a view (inner or outer).

Parameters

mixed $view

The view to render.
array $paths

Look through these paths for view templates.
string $default

If $view is null, use this as the default rendering result.

Returns

string

Tags

None found

getView()

getView(mixed $view, string $format, bool $first_if_empty) : mixed

Gets the view for a particular format.

Parameters

mixed $view

The inner or outer view specification.
string $format

The format to use.
bool $first_if_empty

If the format is empty, use the first available view; otherwise return all available views.

Returns

mixed —

The matching view for the format.

Tags

None found
